titleStmt.title: The vvooing maid, or A faire maid neglected, forlorne and reiected, that would be respected: which to have effected, this generall summon she sendeth in common, come Tinker, come Broomman, she will refuse no man. To the tune of, Il'be the dad out.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: For Thomas Lambert, at the signe of the Hors-shoo in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
